content.description: Start this route by clambering up a massive and solid flake. After clipping the first bolt, you can safely scamper to the top of a nearly vertical face climb that is not without some fun moves.
content.location: Located in the Red Light District between the less intimidating start of Mammplitude to the left and the right-facing dihedral of Timeless Christian Values to the right, The Young and the Restless takes you out over the deck for some exposed moves on comforting jugs before you clip the first bolt.

content.description:
This fun route climbs the eye catching arete formed by the end of the main wall of the Red Light District. 

  Easy climbing for 3 bolts leads to a little boulder problem pulling the obvious small roof.  Surmount this and move left to a no hands stance beneath the arete.  Catch your breath and then finagle your way up the arete, using nice holds on both sides.  No real hard moves, just a little sustained.  I would have given the route 3 stars but the no hands stance detracts.
content.location: From climbers access 2, follow the trail downstream for 150 yards, passing the shorter routes on the ledge.  A tall, clean wall is just to the left.  Vapor Lock climbs the arete on the left side of this wall.  The start is shared with Autocratic for the People.

content.description:
New route that was added after Dixie Cragger's was published.  You walk past it if you walk from Timeless Christian Values to Jacob's Ladder. 

  Quick bit of bouldering to flat ground then the climbing begins.  Crux is in the middle with the last 15' giving you easy jugs to finish.
content.protection: Six bolts and closed shuts at the top.
content.location: Red Light District between section that has Timeless Christian Values and section that has Jacob's Ladder.

content.description: From Dixie Cragger's Atlas:   Climb the orange wall past five bolts to the anchor.
content.protection: 5 bolts, 2 bolt anchor, single bolt for belay anchor
content.location: The right-most route on the ledge, next to Timeless Christian Values

content.description: Just to the left of Jacob's Ladder, a mine field of loose blocks and some good holds. Top 20 feet is a great conglomerate climb with lots of crimps and slopers. Could go with trad gear or you can scramble up the left gully and build an anchor on the pine tree on top. Dirty.
content.protection: Protect with large pine tree at the top.
content.location: 10 feet to the left of Jacob's ladder. Start on jugs in the blocky dihedral. Go straight up dodging the vegetation.Â

content.description:
A really excellent moderate with a lot of nice variety.  It's not often you find your crack-jamming skills come into play on a sport climb.  Non-casual stances for clipping add to the challenge. 

  Starting below a shallow right-facing corner, move up on crimpy face moves past two bolts.  Jam and stem through a short hand crack, then continue past two more bolts to the top.
content.location: Red Light District; starts near the right end of the ledge above the trail, about 15' left of Turnin' Tricks.

content.description: Tricky moves down low, sequency face moves up top and jugs in the middle.
content.location: Toward the end of Red Light District, Size Matters and its partner One Hand in my Pocket and the other on a Stout 11b share the headwall to the left of Mrs. Treated.

content.description: This is a fun face route that starts easy and gets progressively harder. You'll start up some fun 5.6-5.9 territory, and once you move left to the little roof is where the real fun begins. You quickly progress through some 5.10 climbing to hit a few moves of 11 climbing, then it's a few more solid 12c moves to the anchors. Really fun movement throughout and a great sampling of a lot of types of climbing
content.location: Go to the Red Light District. This is outside the main "box-like" feature. Past the main box, there is a tall route climbing the arete that dives into the box. This is Cold Shoulder (10c). Left of that is Butt Trumpet  (12d) and then another route left is Guest Appearance (13a/b). One more route left (shares the same start as Guest) is Proposition #One.

content.description:
Thin and balancy, Pocket Pool is tough and sustained for the grade.  Good footwork comes in handy. 

  Climb the steep face on crimps and the occasional big pocket to the top.
content.protection: Five bolts; closed shuts for anchors.
content.location: Red Light District; near the left end of the section, just right of Jacob's Ladder.

climbs.name: One Hand in my Pocket and the Other on a Stout

content.description: Fun, moderate moves down low lead to a sequency crux on crimpers right before the anchors.
content.location: The next sport route to the left of Mrs. Treated.

content.description: Climb a vertical crack in the face, 10 feet left of the corner, to the top.
content.location: In the Red Light District, from the same ledge as Mammplitude and Dutch Maiden. Starts on the left face of the right-facing corner, on the left end of the ledge.

content.description: Starting slightly overhung with large holds, moving to thinner, face climbing following a large flake on the left with an awkward mantle up high.
content.location: Last bolted route on the left side of the Red Light District. Starts over hung, stays on the left side of the corner.

content.description: Good, fun route that seems easy till you get to the crux. Work up crimps and flakes. You will find the crux at the third bolt to the anchors.
content.location: Red Light District; 10' left of Dutch Maiden.

content.description:
A popular easy lead, Jacob's Ladder is a lot of fun for the grade.  As the name implies, it's got plenty of juggy holds, which you'll be glad to have when you see the first bolt is about 20' off the deck.  A nice long route too. 

  A slightly overhanging start leads to nice climbing on a blocky corner, following bolts and fixed pins to the top.
content.location: Red Light District, near the end of the wall just left of Pocket Pool.

content.description:
Dutch Maiden packs a lot of pump into a short route, saving up a final crux for the last move to the anchors. 

  Climb crimpy holds and occasional positive horizontals past three bolts to the top.
content.location: Red Light District; starts on a ledge above the trail about 10' left of Mammplitude.

content.description: Climb the dirty corner crack. Plenty of cobwebs and a vegetated topout; would be more pleasant if more people led it.
content.protection: Small to medium gear, nothing bigger than a #3 Camalot. I didn't notice any anchors, so I walked over to the bolted anchors of "On the Side" after topping out.
content.location: Corner crack right of "On the Side".

content.description: Starts on large ledge left of main Red Light District wall (direct start also an option). Stay on the arete for a few moves and then swing onto the right side, making easy moves on the face to a juggy, horizontal break in the rock. Shake out and get ready to run it out a bit to the chains. In all, a very cool route.
content.location: Cold Shoulder is in the Red Light District. Locate an arete to the left of the main Red Light District wall.

content.description:
A nice face route that gets little traffic despite climbing good rock with fun albeit slightly tweaky moves. 

  Climb the same 4 bolts as Vapor Lock to a huge rest.  From here the route is on for the next 20 feet or so.  Climb crimps, sidepulls, a sneaky undercling, more sidepulls, all with tricky feet, to an obvious good hold.  The last bit is an easy victory romp leading to double ring anchors. 

  Some of the draws were a little hard to clip. This was my clipping system: From the big rest, easily clip a bolt from the undercling system.  The next bolt would be very hard to clip as you're right in the crux.  I hung a shoulder length sling from this bolt and clipped from the last good hold before starting the crux.  The next bolt I clipped from above once you're out of the business.
content.location: From climbers access 2, follow the trail downstream for 150 yards, passing the shorter routes on the ledge. A tall, clean wall is just to the left. Autocratic for the People climbs the plumb line on the left side of this wall, just to the right of the arete. The start is shared with Vapor Lock.

content.description: Toward the far left end of the cliff, the Red Light District offers a wide variety of routes; the first several of these start on a prominent ledge above the trail.
